indexWelcome: We are here to help your anxiety
indexWelcome2: Start creating healthier self-care habits with the MyMind tracker
indexWhoAreWe2: MyMind is a tool aimed at first-year online students to help manage their anxiety or depression. We are a free resource and collect minimal personal information to best protect your privacy.
indexGoal: Our goal is to help you create a healthier habits by focusing on what you can do and encouraging self-care behaviours. These behaviours are in line with research from top psychologists to best manage anxiety and depression
line1404: It looks like you are lost
line2404: Click on the icon to go home
termsLine1: Welcome to MyMind, a website designed to provide daily tracking for people suffering from depression and anxiety. As a university project, we aim to help those struggling with mental health issues to better understand their emotions and behaviors.
termsLine2: By accessing this website, you agree to the following terms and conditions. First and foremost, we will not collect any personally identifiable information from our users. All data entered into our tracking system is completely anonymous and will be used solely for research purposes.
termsLine3: Our website is not intended to replace professional medical advice or treatment. We strongly advise that you seek the guidance of a mental health professional if you are struggling with depression or anxiety.
termsLine4: While we strive to provide accurate and helpful information, we cannot guarantee the effectiveness of our tracking system or the accuracy of the information provided on this website.
termsLine5: By using MyMind, you agree to hold harmless and indemnify our team, our university, and our partners against any and all claims, damages, or losses arising from your use of this website.
termsLine6: We reserve the right to modify these terms and conditions at any time without prior notice. By continuing to use MyMind, you accept any changes made to these terms and conditions.
termsLine7: Thank you for using MyMind. We hope that our website can provide you with helpful insights and support as you navigate your mental health journey.
aboutLine1: Hi there! We are Lauren, Scott, and Addison, a passionate team of university students committed to improving mental health among young students.
aboutLine2: Our journey started as a university project, and with the creation of MyMind, we strive to empower young individuals to track their habits, identify triggers, and take control of their mental wellbeing.
aboutLine3: Through our platform, we aim to provide a safe and supportive space for students to combat depression and anxiety.
aboutLine4: Join us in fostering a mindful and resilient generation, as we continue to learn, grow, and make a positive impact together.

reviewsHeading: We pride ourselves of being able to inspire our users to take control and create healthier self care habits.  But do not just take our words for it, have a read of what they have to say.
successModalText: You took time and prioritised your well-being!
profileUpdateNoChange: Please change at least one value
passwordValidationNotSame: Please review your passwords. They do not match!
passwordValidationNoNumber: Please make sure your password has at least one number character
passwordValidationNoSpecial: Please make sure your password has at least one special character
passwordValidationNoUpper: Please make sure your password has at least one uppercase character
passwordValidationNoLower: Please make sure your password has at least one lowercase character

healthCheckSurvey: A short health check supported by ABS data to help you focus on your goals
healthCheckQ1: Question 1: How is your overall health today?
healthCheckQ2: Question 2: How many serves of fruit do you eat daily?
healthCheckQ3: Question 3: How many serves of vegetables do you eat Daily?
healthCheckQ4: Question 4: Do you regulary drink sugary drinks?
healthCheckQ5: Question 5: Do you perform 150 minutes of physical activity per week?
healthCheckQ7: Question 7: how much alcohol do you consumer weekly?
healthCheckQ8: Question 8: Do you experience chronic body pains?
healthCheckLine2: Submit your answers and they will be analysed against guidelines and ABS statistics
healthCheckLine3: This is based off the Australian Bureau of Statistics health data on mental and behavioral conditions by health risk factors and health status.
